statement: The natural red dye in the shells of crustaceans is called xanthophyll.
Sac fungi belong to the Protista family.

The Prophet Muhammad worked as a doctor before his religious calling.
According to EU regulations, the volume of an iPhone must not exceed 80 decibels.
11.9% of the earth's surface is 1000 meters above sea level.

The activity of a radioactive substance is measured in Sievert.
The standard base unit of time is milliseconds.
The casing on the first Apple computer was made of aluminium.
'Cum hoc ergo propter hoc' is an example of syllogistic reasoning.
Volcanoes can reach a maximum height of about 5000 metres.

According to the WHO, cancer is the leading cause of death.

In Greece, it is not Friday the 13th that is cursed, but Wednesday the 13th.

The speed at which sound travels is unaffected by temperature.

A swan has about 50,000 feathers on its body.

Ultrasound consists of waves and vibrations below 16 Hertz.
Every odd number greater than two can be the sum of two prime numbers.

In men, excessive sex drive is not called nymphomania, but satyriasis.

Tigers not only have striped fur but also striped skin.

The mathematician Leonhard Euler's Latin squares were the earliest precursors to Sudoku.

The only image that Van Gogh sold during his lifetime was 'The Red Vineyard.'

Only about two percent of the world's population is naturally blonde.
'In varietate concordia' is the official motto of the European Union.
